result.execSummary:
The defendant Calvin L. Conley was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: any probation defendant is now serving

miscConds.notes: GFE to obtain/maintain FTE/FT schooling or a combination thereof, or for any week defendant does not meet that requirement, he must complete 3 verifable job contacts per week and 5 hours community service per week.
Absolute sobriety and may not enter any bars, taverns, or beer tents.

Any assessment, treatment, and counseling as deemed appropriate by PO, including but not limited to AODA and Anger Mangement.
DNA sample w/ surcharge.
May transfer to Portage Co.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

timeConds.notes: I&S to be used for any rule violations.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Clerk Cheree
Case called: 4:04pm
State appears by ADA D.Toldt.  Def appears in person/pro se.  
Waiver of Right to Attorney and Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction filed.  
VRCW

State moves to:
Ct. 1 (DC/Repeater)>>D&RI
Ct. 3 (Misd BJ/Repeater)>>D&RI
COURT GRANTS ABOVE

PLEA:
Ct. 2 (Misd BJ/Repeater)>>NO CONTEST

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  

COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, def is competent to represent self; a factual basis & def guilty

COURT ORDERS: Sentence W/held; 1 year Probation, concurrent to any probation defendant is now serving.
CONDITIONS>> 90 days MCJ I&S to be used for any rule violations; Any assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by PO, including but not limited to AODA and anger management if deemed appropriate by PO; Absolute sobriety, and may not enter bars, taverns, beer tents; GFE to obtain/maintain FTE/FT schooling or a combination thereof, or for any week defendant does not meet that requirement, he must complete 3 verifiable job contacts per week and 5 hours of community service per week; 40 hours of community service; CC; DNA sample and surchage.

>>Probation to be transferred to Portage County

of No Contact signed by J.N. dated 10-15-15

Final pre-trial at 11-24-2015 09:40 am.
Jury Trial at 12-07-2015 08:30 am.

No contact with victim(s):  J.N.  Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.  Police escort to retrieve any personal belongings (Portage County SD).  Absolute sobriety from drugs and alcohol.
